questions.question: Q1. Which is the most effective way to have labels for different street types be shown at different scale ranges?

alternatives.alternative: Use the Draw toolbar to create text boxes for each street type
Create label classes for each type of street
Create a separate layer for each street type
This is not possible. Labels are the same at all scale ranges

questions.question: Q2. In ArcGIS Pro, what are the two viewing modes for scenes?
Q3. When an ArcMap .mxd file is imported into ArcGIS Pro, what is each data frame in the original document converted to in the ArcGIS Pro project?
Q4. Which is a collection of raster datasets stored as a catalog that allows you to view or access the datasets as a single merged image or individual images?

alternatives.alternative:
a folder of raster data files

Reference

questions.question: Q5. Using the explore tool in ArcGIS Pro, how do you zoom in and out of the map?

alternatives.alternative: Press shift and left-click to zoom in. Press ctrl and left-click to zoom out.
Hold the left mouse button, and drag up to zoom in and drag down to zoom out.
Move the mouse scroll wheel forward to zoom out and backward to zoom in.

Click and drag a box with the left mouse button to zoom in; press shift and drag a box to zoom out.

Reference

questions.question: Q6. Which Layer in this map is currently not visible in the data frame?
Q7. When you zoom in on a map, how are you changing the view

alternatives.alternative: from a higher scale to a lower scale
from a smaller scale to a larger scale
from a lower scale to a higher scale
from a larger scale to a smaller scale

questions.question: Q8. Where are parcel fabrics, geometric networks, and topologies created?
Q9. Which of these methods is best for sharing a map with colleagues who do not have ArcMap or ArcGis Pro?

alternatives.alternative: Export the map to PDF and send your colleagues the PDF.
Export the map to KML and ask your colleagues to download Google Earth.
Publish the map as a service and then create a web map that you can share with your colleagues
Export the map to a map package, and ask your colleagues to download and install the free Map Package Viewer software

questions.question: Q10. You built a model and verified that it works as intended by running it on your own data files. What is the best way to share the entire procedure with colleagues so that they can study it, reproduce your results exactly, and then apply the model to their own data?

alternatives.alternative: Convert the model to Python and upload the results to ArcGIS Online as a service.
Run the consolidated Model tool to gather the model and input datasets into a shared folder

questions.question: Q11. Which is an example of geographic coordinate system?
Q12. When you create a bookmark of your current map view, what is being saved?

alternatives.alternative: the map's current scale and center point
the visibility status of each layer
the center point of the current view

questions.question: Q13. What geoprocessing tool, when applied to the Point Data Layer, is most likely responsible for the data shown in the Result Layer?
Q14. By default, as what do all geoprocessing tools run from dialog boxes execute?
Q15. A grayscale raster is said to have a single **_** while a full-color RGB raster has three **_**.
Q16. Which Classification method places approximately the same number of values in each class **_**.
Q17. You want to add a time and date to your map layout that will update when the map is printed. What element should you add to do this ? **_**.
